2 April.event: al-Qaeda linked Nusra Front and other Syrian rebels attack Syrian government forces, and take a strategic hill from them.

refs.text: Nusra Front, Syrian rebels attack government forces near Aleppo, gain ground

4 April.event: Syrian government forces seize the town of al-Qaryatain from the Islamic State.

refs.text: Syria war: 'Islamic State' loses al-Qaryatain to government forces
Syrian troops drive Islamic State out of another town
Syrian troops take Islamic State-controlled town of Qaryatain
Syrian forces seize Islamic State-held town near Palmyra

4 April.event: Turkish authorities jails the Turkish fighter accused by the Russian Federation of the killing of a Russian Su-24 pilot.

refs.text: Turkish Court Jails Fighter Wanted By Russia For Killing Pilot

5 April.event: The Syrian affiliate of al-Qaeda, the al-Nusra Front, shoot down and capture a pilot of the Syrian Arab Air Force near Aleppo.

refs.text: Al-Nusra Rebels Shot Down a Syrian Warplane and Captured Its Pilot
Syrian conflict: Al Nusra Front rebels shoot down Assad regime warplane, capture pilot, monitor says
Nusra Front captures pilot from downed Syrian jet
Syrian jet shot down in Aleppo, pilot reportedly captured by Al-Qaeda affiliate
Syria army jet downed, pilot captured in Aleppo

6 April.event: “Abu Saqqqar” a Syrian rebel that appeared on 2013 in a video trying to eat the heart of a dead Syrian soldier, is killed in the countryside of Idlib.

refs.text: The man who ate the heart of a regime forces’ soldier “Abu Saqqar” is killed.

15 April.event: At least 210 combatants are killed in Syria Aleppo during a week of fighting; 82 regime troops, 94 rebels and 34 Islamic State jihadists according to the Syrian Observatory of Human Rights

1 February.event: The Syrian Army announces the beginning of the 3rd Phase of the Lattakia Offensive with the aim of sealing the Northeastern Corner of the Latakia Governorate and create a frontline at the rebel city of Jisr Al-Shughour.

refs.text: http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-begins-3rd-phase-of-latakia-offensive/

3 February.event: The Syrian Army has broken the Siege of Nubl and Al-Zahraa in the northern Aleppo Governorate, linking with the defenders of Nubl at village of Mu’arrassat al-Khan after a 3-days battle.

refs.text: http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUKKCN0VC1WI

4 February.event: A top Saudi defence chief said Saudi-Arabia is ready to send ground troops to Syria if the United States accepts it.

refs.text: Saudi Ready To Send Ground Troops To Syria

4 February.event: The United Arab Emirates announced its intentions to deploy ground forces in Syria according to Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Anwar Gargash, however it added that United States lead was a prerequisite for the UAE.

refs.text: UAE says it is ready to send ground troops to Syria

7 February.event: The Syrian Foreign Minister warned against a foreign ground intervention; saying that any foreign army troops entering Syria without government consent would "return home in wooden coffins", Syria's Foreign Minister Walid al-Muallem said, in reference to Saudi Arabia remarks made in the past two days.

refs.text: Syria says any foreign troops would 'return in coffins'

7 February.event:
Bassam al-Kuwaiti, a political Syrian Opposition figure told Voice of America that Moderate Opposition face a wipe out in Northern Aleppo as the Russian backed Syrian offensive continues.
Free Syrian Army forces are already relying on Ahrar al-Sham and Al-Qaeda linked al-Nusra, being merge and disband their last option.

refs.text: Moderate Syrian Rebel Factions Face Wipe-Out

8 February.event: Former MI6 agent Alastair Crooke, warns about an imminent Syrian Army encircling of Aleppo Jihadists Groups, inside a cauldron at Northern Aleppo.

refs.text: The Syria War Will Not Be a Quagmire -- Because Putin and Assad Are Winning

12 February.event: Three U.S backed Shite militias are now working with Pro-Syrian Army forces fighting other U.S Backed rebels in Southern Aleppo, according to two United State defense officials.

refs.text: Exclusive: U.S. Allies Now Fighting CIA-Backed Rebels

13 February.event: Turkey shells YPG positions in northern Aleppo.

refs.text: Turkey shells Kurdish-held air base in Syria's Aleppo

15 February.event: A Russian air strike has destroyed a compound in northern Syria with least seven people dead and more than ten people missing presumed to be dead.

refs.text: Russian airstrikes destroy Doctors Without Borders-backed hospital in Syria, activists say
Syria crisis: Hospital strike deliberate, says MSF

15 February.event: Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoğlu accuses Russia of acting as a "terrorist organization" in Syria, saying "If Russia continues behaving like a terrorist organization and forcing civilians to flee, we will deliver an extremely decisive response".

refs.text: Turkey PM: Russia acts like 'terrorist organization' - Latest News Briefs - Arutz Sheva

17 February.event: Al-Arabiyah reports of Turkish oficcials discomfort with the United States regarding its stance with the Kurds.

refs.text: Kurds' advance in Syria divides U.S. and Turkey as Russia bombs

18 February.event: Adel al-Jubeir, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, announced that a US-led ground operation in Syria would focus on fighting ISIS, not the Syrian regime.

refs.text: Saudi ground forces would target ISIS in Syria: minister

21 February.event: At least 46 people were killed and several injured in a double car bombs explosion in the city of Homs.

refs.text: Syria conflict: Homs and Damascus bomb blasts kill 140

21 February.event: At least 30 people were killed in several bomb blasts near Damascus.

refs.text: Yli sata kuoli terrori-iskuissa Syyriassa

21 February.event: Both incidents were masterminded by ISIS.
The Syrian Arab Army and pro-government forces have encircled and overrun the Al-Safira plains between Aleppo and Kuweires Military Airbase.

refs.text: Battle for Al-Safira Plains in east Aleppo is over: Tiger Forces capture every village

21 February.event: 20 villages were seized over the previous 24 hours and 40 kilometers of highway were cleared.

refs.text: Syrian army seizes Aleppo villages, takes aim at Raqqa
Advances for regime forces in Aleppo countryside

21 February.event: In addition, 50 ISIS fighters were killed in the past 24 hours.

refs.text: 50 IS fighters killed in Syria regime Aleppo advance: monitor

22 February.event: United States and Russia agree an all party ceasefire that will exclude the ISIS and the al-Qaeda-linked Nusra Front begin on 27 February.

refs.text: Syria conflict: US-Russia brokered truce to start at weekend

22 February.event: Jund al-Aqsa and the Free Syrian Army captured the village of Rasm al-Nafal, to the southwest of Lake Jabbul, severing the Ithriyah-Khanasser Highway again for the second time in 5 months. In a coordinated action, ISIL had also captured multiple villages along the southern shore of Lake Jabbul and to the south of Rasm al-Nafal, sealing off more of the Aleppo road and Sheikh Hilal-Ithriyah Road. Counter-attacks by Syrian Arab Army have failed to immediately dislodge militants from the majority of the captured positions.

refs.text: Syrian government supply route to Aleppo still cut as fierce clashes continue
ISIS cuts two different government supply routes

25 February.event: In the aftermath of the combined rebel and ISIL breakthrough south of Lake Jabbul, Syrian Arab Army has launched a large-scale counter-attack, dislodging ISIL from the town of Khanasir, captured by militants 2 days before.

refs.text: Tiger Forces recapture the important city of Khanasser from ISIS

27 February.event: The United Nations Security Council unanimously adopted a resolution that demanded all parties to comply with the terms

refs.text: Joint Statement of the United States and the Russian Federation, as Co-Chairs of the ISSG, on Cessation of Hostilities in Syria

27 February.event: of a U.S.-Russian deal on a "cessation of hostilities".

refs.text: Temporary truce comes into effect

28 February.event: Saudi Arabia accuses Russia and Syria of ceasefire violations

refs.text: Last Hour: Saudi blames Russia, Syria for truce violations

29 February.event: Russian and U.S brokered ceasefire takes places despite accusations by parties involved.

refs.text: Spotlight: Syrian cease-fire holds, remains fragile amid accusations

29 February.event: France wants answers on ceasefire violations.

refs.text: Syria ceasefire task force meets, France wants answers on violations

29 February.event: The Syrian Arab Army has re-opened  a supply route to Aleppo city,

refs.text: Syrian Army officially reopens strategic supply route to Aleppo

29 February.event: completing a 2016 Khanasir offensive against ISIL.

4 January.event: After days of clashes with the Free Syrian Army and Islamic Front Forces the Syrian Army seize 55-60% of Sheikh Miskeen at the Daraa Governorate.

refs.text: Battle for Sheikh Miskeen intensifies as Islamists counter at Battalion 82 HQ

4 January.event: Free Syrian Army groups supported the Saudi decision to sever diplomatic ties with Iran.

refs.text: Free Syrian Army issues a statement in support of Saudi Arabia severing ties with Iran

6 January.event: Abu Rateb al-Homsy, leader of Ahrar al-Sham rebel group in Homs is assassinated by unknown gunmen in the village of Farhaniyeh.

refs.text: Gunmen assassinate commander of Syrian rebel group

7 January.event: Pro Government National Defence Forces (Syria) captures the desert village of Al-Bayarat in the northwestern countryside of Palmyra from Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant. There were also clashes between the two parties near the small village of Al-Dawa.

refs.text: Breaking: Syrian Army captures Al-Bayarat in west Palmyra

7 January.event: On the same day, People's Protection Units fought Islamic State (IS) militants, defending Ain Issa, Sarrin, and Tishrin Dam which was seized from IS in December 2015.

refs.text: Kurdish Forces Battle IS to Keep Control of Strategic Syrian Dam

11 January.event: A United Nations-led aid convoy enters the besieged town of Madaya to deliver food and medical aid to 40,000 people.  Aid also reaches the villages of Al-Fu'ah and Kafriya, under siege by rebel forces in the Idlib Governorate.

refs.text: Madaya Syria: Aid convoy reaches besieged town

12 January.event: Syrian Armed forces take control of the rebel Bastion of Salma in the Latakia Governorate

refs.text: Syria: Army seizes 'full control' of rebel-held town, Salma

17 January.event: Syrian Rebels declare full control of Doudyan, Yani Yaban, Baraghadeh, Al Yaroubiyeh villages in Northeastern Allepo, which they took from ISIS

refs.text: Sami on Twitter
AEJ خليل ้้้้้็็็็Ⓜ on Twitter

17 January.event: See also: Deir ez Zor massacre
The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant abducts over 400 civilians from Al-Baghaliyeh suburb in the eastern Syrian city of Deir Ezzor,

refs.text: ISIS abducts over 400 civilians in Syria's Deir Ezzor

17 January.event: after clashes with Syrian Army forces and their allies that left over 150 combatants killed.

refs.text: Syria conflict: Conflicting accounts of Deir al-Zour attack

24 January.event: A ballistic missile struck an Al-Nusra Front run police station in Idlib killing 11 Islamist Fighters and 5 civilians.

refs.text: Missile kills 11 Islamists, 5 others in Syria’s Idlib. Alarabiyah.com Retrieved 25.01.2016

25 January.event: Syrian Army units and its allies capture the southern rebel bastion of Shaykh Maskin cutting off rebels supplies towards Daara.

refs.text: Tide turns in Syrian war with capture of key town

31 January.event: 71 people were killed in suicide bomb blast in Damascus that was established by terrorist organization ISIS.

refs.text: Syria says 45 killed in Damascus area blast

2 March.event: A car bomb killed at least 18 members of the Syria Revolutionaries Front including its leader Muhammad al-Qairi, also known as Abu Hamza al-Naimi in southern Syria. The attack was likely carried out by ISIS sleeper cells.

refs.text: Syria rebel leader killed in Golan car bombing

4 March.event: Two Syrian air strikes hit the town of Douma in Eastern Ghouta, leaving one person killed; it is unknown if the dead was a civilian or a rebel fighter. Over 118 people have been killed during the 5 day long ceasefire areas including 24 civilians. Meanwhile, in non truce areas the dead ascended to 552, mostly in clashes against the Islamic State.

refs.text: 135 , including 32 civilians, were killed in 7 days of military operations in the truce areas

12 March.event: Syrian rebels reported that they have shot down a warplane near Hama.

refs.text: Syria rebels say they shot down warplane

12 March.event: The Al Qaeda-linked Nusra Front seized the bases and weapons of a Western-backed rebel group in overnight fighting in northwestern Syria.

refs.text: Al Qaeda in Syria seizes bases, weapons of Western-backed group

12 March.event: Syria’s foreign minister, Walid al-Muallem said that peace talks will fail if any party tries to discuss the presidency in a transition government, calling the incumbent president, Bashar al-Assad, a “red line”.

refs.text: Syrian government calls Bashar al-Assad a 'red line' in peace talks

15 March.event: Russia started a partial withdrawal of troops from Syria, however air strikes will continue.

refs.text: Vladimir Putin orders Russian military to begin withdrawal from Syria

24 March.event: Syrian regime forces retake Palmyra, with the assistance of Russian airstrikes, after losing it to ISIL in May 2015.

refs.text: Syrian troops enter city of Palmyra after Russian airstrikes
Syrian army captures parts of ISIL-held Palmyra
Palmyra: Syria forces 'enter Islamic State-held city'
